page.title: 14Farming
page.content: Irton Produce,which was opened in 1975,is a typical market garden.It is situated about 7 kilometres outside Scarborough,just to the north of the village of Irton,and so most of its produce is sold locally,to shops and markets.The market garden covers 10 hectares and is intensively cultivated growing a wide range of crops,either in the open or under glass.These include strawberries,cabbages,peas, shrubs,potatoes and pot plants.The garden is privately owned:it employs 2 full time workers and many part time workers (particularly in harvest time) when the produce is hand picked.There is a limited use of machinery,such as 2 tractors,2 ploughs and 4 trailers. They also sell fertilizers,plant foods pesticides and also hot and cold drinks.The owner lives in his own cottage on the premises.
